intro: Ulmaria multijuga, commonly known as lesser cow-wheat, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Oxyuraceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and it is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal medicine. Ulmaria multijuga is also valued for its role in supporting pollinator populations.
